description: This file is a shell script for configuring syslog settings, including log levels, log targets, and reinitialization of syslog daemons on a Unix-like system.

methods.name: get_log_level
methods.description: Prompts the user to input the desired log level and sets the corresponding internal variable.

methods.name: start_syslog
methods.description: Initializes syslog configuration by creating necessary symbolic links and starting syslog daemon with appropriate log level.

methods.name: set_docsis_target
methods.description: Sets the log target for DOCSIS logs based on user input.

methods.name: set_kern_target
methods.description: Sets the log target for kernel logs based on user input.

methods.name: ask_reboot
methods.description: Asks the user whether to restart syslog services and performs restart if confirmed.
